projectPurpose: To provide a high-performance, scalable, and flexible zero-knowledge virtual machine that can prove the correct execution of arbitrary computations, enabling verifiable computing at internet scale.
mainFeatures: Modular, extensible, prover-optimized zkVM
Written in Rust for performance and security
Generates succinct, verifiable zero-knowledge proofs for arbitrary computations
Architected for massively parallelized incremental proof generation
Supports high-speed recursive proof systems (Jolt, HyperNova) and IVC/PCD
Features the NVM, optimized for prover performance and ISA simulation
Open-source and built on open scientific research

alternatives.name: RISC Zero zkVM
mainFeatures: RISC-V based zkVM
Proves arbitrary Rust code execution
Generates zero-knowledge proofs (receipts)
Supports recursive proofs (zk-STARKs, Groth16)
Universal verifier for cross-chain proof verification

alternatives.name: Polygon Miden
mainFeatures: STARK-based zero-knowledge virtual machine
Focuses on private data storage and local transaction execution
Designed for general-purpose computing
Aims for a future-proof VM design

alternatives.name: Cairo VM (StarkWare)
mainFeatures: Virtual machine for the Cairo programming language
Generates STARK proofs for general computation
Turing-complete
Supports smart contracts (within Starknet ecosystem)

alternatives.name: zkSync Era VM (EraVM)
mainFeatures: Custom zkVM for the zkSync Era network
EVM compatible via compiler
Uses zk-rollup technology for Ethereum scaling
Processes transactions off-chain with ZKP generation

alternatives.name: Scroll zkEVM
mainFeatures: EVM-equivalent zkRollup for Ethereum scaling
Bytecode-level compatibility with EVM
Allows easy deployment of existing smart contracts
Generates zkEVM validity proofs

marketPositioning: The Nexus zkVM positions itself as a high-performance, modular, and extensible general-purpose zero-knowledge virtual machine, focusing on proving *any* computation efficiently through features like parallelization, incremental verification, and advanced proof systems. While other notable zkVMs often focus on specific ecosystems (like zkEVMs for Ethereum compatibility) or particular architectures (like RISC-V), Nexus emphasizes its own NVM architecture and its ambition to be a foundational technology for a verifiable internet beyond just blockchain scaling, aiming for massive compute capacity.
